name: Villa Victoria Lodge

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a brilliant stay at Villa Victoria. The house & garden are absolutely beautiful and the pool was a welcome relief from the hot sun! The staff were very helpful arranging pick up from Mendoza, bike hire & even giving us a lift in to town for dinner one night. Breakfast was delicious, especially the fresh figs from the garden.
reviews.title: Excellent!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would thoroughly recommend a stay at Villa Victoria Wine Lodge, it was one of the highlights of our South America trip and a lovely respite in the countryside.
reviews.title: Perfect location for wine tours of Mendoza

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Villa Victoria Wine Lodge was incredible. From the moment we arrived, we were treated as welcomed guests. Our room was enormous and comfortable. Mariano arranged a marvelous wine tour for us with our charming driver and guide, Javier. We toured three wineries and had
reviews.title: Awesome stay at Villa Victoria!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: a gourmet lunch with wine pairings at our final destination. Another great winery was within
reviews.title: Terrific stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: walking distance of the Villa Victoria. After our strenuous day of serious wine tasting, we were happy to swim in the Lodge's delightful swimming pool.
reviews.title: Ideal stay in wine country

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a gorgeous mansion in the heart of Maipu, one of the main areas for wineries in Mendoza. The Rodriguez family is very welcoming and the caretakers make you feel at home. Contrary to some of the reviews, pretty much everything is homemade from the freshly baked croissant to the homemade jams. The grounds are massive and the pool is refreshing. It is true that the mansion is a good 30 minute drive from the city of Mendoza and that the downtown restaurants in Maipu require access to a car. That being said I would NOT recommend renting a car in Mendoza. Villa Victoria offers transfers from the airport and the taxis should be sufficient for transportation. In addition, navigating around Maipu and Mendoza is a little confusing and the GPS is not that reliable.
reviews.title: Extremely great value stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There are only 4 rooms in this property, and we had the place to ourselves for half of our stay. There is a lot of charm and character about the 100 year old property that used to be the mansion house of the British railway managers who worked on the building the railroad.
reviews.title: Historic property, great location, superb service

reviews.text: I would thoroughly recommend this place if you are looking for something a bit more than a standard hotel, it is right in the middle of the Maipu bodega tour. The hotel managers are amazing, they prepare a great continental breakfast, give great recommendations, and made a note of our tours and pick up times. Nothing was too mush trouble - and there are a few wild guinea pigs in the garden!
reviews.title: Charming stay, lovely grounds

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed one night here in Maipu. It is a lovely property - I would liken it to a large guest house instead of a hotel. It is in a large Victoria-like house. The owners live there with a very nice assistant - excellent English and very helpful.
reviews.title: Too expensive, poor service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The property is very large with a nice outdoor area - you feel like you're in a friend's backyard - nice pool, gorgeous and friendly Great Dane, relaxed, chilled. There is no vineyard on the property.
reviews.title: Heaven in the Andes

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Can't say enough great things about the Villa Victoria. Besides the great house and grounds, it is located very close to several bodegas and restaurants. Spring for one of the suites if you can, the huge amount of room and views are definitely worth it. The staff was also extremely helpful. They helped us rent bikes for our first day there and had them waiting for us when we woke up. They also made all of our restaurant reservations and called cabs for us when we needed them. An excellent property all around, I hope to make it back one day.
reviews.title: Exactly where you need to be

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here in February 2012 and really enjoyed our stay. The location was simply perfect, right in the middle of many vineyards and a short walk away from a small market where you can pick up dinner or lunch. They keep some bikes at the hotel, so instead of going to town to pick up bikes you can simply rent them there. It was such a great stay!
reviews.title: Perfect Location!

reviews.text: The pool at the hotel was so welcome in the hot days of summer. I read another person's review who said the rooms were hot, but with the fan and AC, we did not encounter that particular issue.
reviews.title: The best place to stay in Mendoza

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff at the hotel (Gisele and Jordan) were amazing. They almost anticipated our every need, so instead of us asking, they asked us. They make the hotel worth it! We would most definitely stay there again.
reviews.title: Beautiful property, lovely staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The best experience on my last travel to Mendoza was staying at this wonderful 'Posada'. Everything was just Perfect!, The House, The gardens, People, Relax. I will strongly recommend Villa Victoria to all my friends, and I am sure, they will appreciate it !!!. Words are not enough ... Thanks to the Staff at Villa Victoria !!.
reviews.title: Nice place near the Bodegas

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Many thanks to all the staff at the Victoria Wine Lodge, Mary and I had a wonderful weekend in your faboulous wine country, cheers !
reviews.title: Great victorian experience !

reviews.text: I am the CEO of an importer of Argentinean wine to the UK (www.ruta40.com) and hence spend a lot of time in Mendoza province. Out of all the places I have stayed at, this is my favourite if you are staying in or near Mendoza. Villa Victoria is located in Maipu - in the heart of one of the best wine growing areas within the province - and about 30 minutes by car from the centre of Mendoza. The location provides the best of both worlds - near enough the Mendoza city in case you want to go out in the evenings - and at the same time you get the beauty and tranquility of being in the center of the wine country.
reviews.title: My No.1 place to stay in Mendoza and its surroundings

reviews.text: Villa Victoria is owned and managed by the super friendly and helpful Mariano. Having his own wine lodge has always been his dream and it shows in the attention to detail and the love with which this property has been renovated. The rooms are large, the bathrooms brand new, the linen and towels of a quality that you would normally expect in a 4 Seasons. The lodge has only 5 rooms, which makes it nice and intimate. The gardens surrounding the villa ensure peace and quite and are a great place to relax after having spent the day visiting wineries. The pool is a gem - lined with black natural stone in order to heat the warm efficiently by the sun.
reviews.title: A Hidden Jewel at the Heart of the Wine Route
Excellent customer service
reviews.text: The other advantage of the location is that two of the best wineries in the area are literally 5 minutes away. Head to Bodega Carinae for a visit in the morning and then over to what I consider to be Mendoza's best terrace - Bodega Tempus Alba for lunch or for a gorgeous glass of wine to go with the sunset.
Been there for New Year’s eve and then again last week. Loved it!! It`s the perfect place to relax, chill out and enjoy life.
reviews.title: At the heart of the wine route, a place with style.

aka: Villa Victoria Lodge Mendoza, Argentina - Maipu
description: Villa Victoria Wine & Lodge is characterized for being a well preserved old Victorian country home of the late nineteenth century set amidst a stunning setting of gardens and grounds. Both the décor and furnishings were designed to follow the lines of this style.It features five bedrooms with private bathroom on two floors, all fully equipped for a pleasant stay. Their large windows give light and an unparalleled view of the land and the mountains.
